sub_title: Textile & Apparel Designer, Instructor, Consultant at Eloïse Ptito
summary:
Eloïse Ptito-Echeverria is a textile-apparel designer and hand-embroidery instructor currently based in Amsterdam, NL. Driven by intelligent print and ethical design, she possesses a particular penchant for textiles, embroidery, and bold colour. 

After completing her Fine Arts degree in 2011, she reconnected with her roots and lived in Santiago, Chile for a year where she apprenticed in Rococo hand-embroidery and studied Precolumbian-Andina textiles at l’Universidad Catolica de Diseño. Upon graduating from Ryerson University’s School of Fashion (SOF), her designs went on to be shown at Toronto Women’s Fashion Week and at The Canadian Fashion History Museum’s exhibit, "Then Now Next”; showcasing Canada’s most influential designers from both past and present. Later that year, she was awarded Brettons’ Designer of the Year (2017). Her work has additionally been showcased within Selvedge Magazine (UK), The Toronto Star, The Kit, Blanc Magazine, Not Just a Label, and at the Condé Nast International Luxury Conference in Lisbon, Portugal.

www.eloiseptito.com
@eloiseptito
